main event: A bright green light was observed falling almost straight down in Los Alamos, New Mexico on 3rd March 1949, at 0159 hours. The observation was made by an Atomic Energy Security Services Inspector while facing East.
interesting points: The object was bright green in color and fell almost straight down from the direction of East North-East.
The observer was a Sgt. from the Area I, Section I and was engaged in conversation at the time of the sighting.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting included broken clouds at 25,000 feet.
There was no sound associated with the observed object, and no specific information was provided regarding speed or altitude.
The observer did not report any additional information concerning the object, and the light was described as bright throughout the observation.
result: prozaic explanation (Astro (meteor) noted at the bottom of the first page)
sighted object: bright green light falling almost straight down
